intro: Hieracium elisaeanum subsp. segurae, commonly known as the Segura's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showing adaptability to arid environments. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other members of the Hieracium genus. It is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance in its native range.
